roleset.name: give praise

role.descr: praised for what (if in addition to arg1)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: [National leaders]-1 stopped by his stand *trace*-1 to commend his achievements.

example.name: with grounds as gerund
example.text: The internal investigation also commended MiniScribe's auditors, Coopers & Lybrand, for allegedly ignoring numerous red flags.
example.arg: for allegedly ignoring numerous red flags

example.name: with grounds as full clause
example.text: A Poquet spokesman, for example, commends the Atari Portfolio because it requires three batteries while the Poquet needs only two.
example.arg: because it requires three batteries while the Poquet needs only two

example.name: adjectival rel: commendable
example.text: It goes without saying that his bravery is truly commendable .

roleset.note: Based on wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet; adjectival 'commendable' based on BOLT-4,5; nominal 'commendation' based on BOLT-6. Member of VNcls judgement-33.

example.name: nominal rel: commendation
example.text: To err is human . We should give him a chance , a chance of turning over a new leaf , and the commendation for bravely acting for justice is also an encouragement to him . We ca n't deny a person 's whole life just because of one thing .
